definition: to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
to be unable to hold back

sentences.english: After a while, Pao-yu could wait no longer, so he stepped forward and removed the veil.
sentences.chinese: 又过了一会，宝玉实在按捺不住，上前揭了盖头。

sentences.english: Josie found it hard to keep her temper.
sentences.chinese: 乔西觉得很难按捺住她的脾气。

sentences.english: I could not curb my anger.

definition: to pacify/to calm down/to be cured/to be healed
to be unable to hold back
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to compose oneself/to concentrate one's attention
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
to endure/to bear with/to exercise patience/to restrain oneself/patience/endurance
